body:
Yeah, this is obv my first time ever creating music or something. It isn't that great, but no one is really looking at it and giving me suggestions.

I'd love if any of y'all could!


Thanks:

This 1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fz2Yil4nzdo
or
This 1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HG-AKIb-B9w

Thanks if you did. If not, have a nice day anyway!

replies.body: It's alright. Don't take my opinion too seriously though, since I'm more of a fan of music like https://youtu.be/lru6-J7uQjo, https://youtu.be/vx2u5uUu3DE and https://youtu.be/pzYfLBN0yxQ, so that kind of music doesn't really appeal to me.

replies.body:
I like the Beesting one better. However... get rid of the Sans part, it threw off the song a bit and took me by surprise.

All in all, good music you have here but it'll be better if it didn't have that part. Didn't fit in at all in my opinion.

replies.body:
I also have a music suggestion (Not sure how these things work)

If you can make a dubstepish song that sounds like a roaming band of tanks going to a large battle then that'd be awesome.

Just... do it if you can... Got have those rolling tones... glides along your skin and you can feel it through out your body...

Imagine the gun shots and the tank's cannons going *KERPOOO-WEEAHOWOOHHhhhhhh!* 

*Cough* Sorry... I play a lot of War Thunder... 

If I'm asking for too much then that's fine XD

replies.body:
Hi, thank you for the suggestion! I'll try to make things flow better as yeah... that part was a bit off.

@_Distraction_ I'm saving up to buy something good right now, as music interests me, but for now I'm using some free software on Linux: Linux Multimedia Studio and sometimes muse. They are really good in my opinion and honestly much better than some paid ones (I dual boot solely for these two applications).

@Zintenka I'll try to! Will post it (if) when done.

replies.body:
Feedback: Learn MIXING!!!!!!

The most important thing about music production (in my stand point) is mixing. There are a ton of tutorials that can help you. Speaking DAW's (Digital Audio Workstation), which one interests you the most? I know you're using a free one that comes with Linux, but there are way to many and some are more complicated than others. I suggest going with FL Studios 12. Others might disagree with me and say "FL Studios is not easier than Ableton". Trust me, that's a lie, especially since you're a beginner. The clipping in both of those songs are terrifying i guess. But you're a beginner, so it's okay. Message me if you need anything! My skype is: google_processing
replies.body_tagged:
